column4: Okay would 'mv ./*/*/*/*/* ./' move all files within the current directory's subdirectories into the current directory?
do you want to keep the directory structure or no?
here's what you could try: make a copy of some of your stuff (junk maybe) and try it there
it keeps the directory structure but I don't know how to remove the directory structure
yes it would, just tried it
what's that do? only lets it go into 'x' amount of directorires?
and h1gh: thanks im sure that command will be useful sometime in the future :)
and h1gh asked in #linux too, they said 'find . -mindepth 2 -type f -exec mv -it . {} +' b/c it doesn't fork mv each time
I made a shell script for the command. want it?
as in don't make it show?
depends on where you live, COULDnt that be illegal?
still, there is the real world
and for other cool grub stuff, go to this forum thread: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1195275
